greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Following the successive antidiagonals in A275895, let the n-th queen appear in square (x(n),y(n)); sequence gives x(n).
comment: This is a permutation of the nonnegative numbers.
This assumes the indexing starts at 0. See A275899, A275900 if the indexing begins at 1.
link: N. J. A. Sloane, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10386
maple: # Alternative Maple program from _N. J. A. Sloane_, Oct 03 2016
for n from 1 to M2 do
for s from ss[n-1]+1 to M2 do
for i from 0 to s do
not member(x-y,dd,'p') then sw:=1; break; fi;
if sw=-1 then lprint("error, n=",n); break; fi;
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 24 2016
